text: <@U25C6PU56> is this still happening?
cc <@UEKMY50SU>
<@U6W3H6YN8> Yep, it’s getting worse too
I’m trying to wipe out everything and start with a fresh create (again) and a new name. Will know if that’s it shortly
Could you share with me a link to the theme with the problem, please? We can take a look
One sec, I already deleted it
I’m doing a fresh create and upload from boilerplate with a new name to see if the issues replicate. If they do, there is probably something up with the latest CLI update or my portal/server.
<@U6W3H6YN8> OK! A fresh create and upload from boilerplate with a new name finally solved it. Must have been something quirky
Strange! Glad things are working now, but please share if you run into it again
Thats ok, just wanted to make sure :slightly_smiling_face:
I will, thanks for checking in, Will! Just another day with adventures in local dev tools!
don't think this is the issue, but the `version`, `author`, `documentation_url` and `example_url` properties aren't valid `theme.json` properties
what is the command you're using to upload?

Hey, trying to upload a module fields.json file and I’m getting “[ERROR] ‘text’ is a restricted field type”. It shows for each occurrence of a “type: text” field in the module, but I’m not seeing any difference from what I have and any other core modules. Thoughts?
we restrict `text` fields for `fields.json` in themes, but not for modules. but to clarify, you're seeing this behavior for a module, not a theme?
module within a theme, yes, and in the fields.json file.

Here’s a snippet…

“children”: [
      {
        “label”: “Headline”,
        “name”: “headline”,
        “type”: “text”,
        “default”: “Default Text Here”
      },
weird, works just fine for me :thinking_face: what's the command you're using to upload?

watch generally… and sometimes do Command-Save for individual files. No matter how I do it, this file won’t save and I get that error 9 times, which syncs with the 9 text fields in the module. Haven’t had this issue with any other modules at this point so there’s gotta be something goofy I’m not seeing.
can you send the command line output for when this file is uploaded?

[ERROR] Uploading file /Users/nathan/Documents/hslocal/my-theme/src/modules/hero-slider/fields.json to my-theme/src/modules/hero-slider/fields.json failed
[ERROR] internal error
[ERROR] ‘text’ is a restricted field type
hm i would expect the path to be `hero-slider.module`
what happens if you try uploading the file directly?
i.e. `npx hs upload /Users/nathan/Documents/hslocal/my-theme/src/modules/hero-slider.module/fields.json /my-theme/src/modules/hero-slider.module/fields.json`
(note the `.module` postfix for the `hero-slider` module
[ERROR] The path “/my-theme/src/modules/hero-slider.module/fields.json” is not a path to a file or folder
is your `hero-slider` directory is missing the `.module` postfix altogether?

yes that’s missing for this module. Grrr now to figure out why. The other files for the module still uploaded. I’ll track it down as I’m sure this is the issue. Didn’t even notice that. It’s the only module that is missing the .module. Figures… Thanks!

i would think that the other files just got uploaded to a `hero-slider` directory as regular file types (rather than as part of a module). The `fields.json` file just happened to choke on a specific validation constraint. but yeah, renaming the directory to `hero-slider.module` should fix the issue
yeah it fixed it. :slightly_smiling_face: Those annoying little details… haha

We were having an issue between one of our Gravity Forms and HubSpot to where anytime someone saved the Gravity Form, HubSpot would send the form completion email along side an email from Gravity Forms causing our emails to goto spam. As a solution we have added the following PHP script
will this cause a disconnect with HubSpot's other triggers (ie form completion)?
